title: Looks a bit like a condensed Time New Roman, but serifs are longer and finer.
author: DavidAYoung

comments.content: You could try **[Times Eighteen Roman](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317121704/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Linotype&ffam=TimesEighteen%20LT%20Roman%20-%20Regular&fid=83dcc5aa89b978eb350dc618fab30468&fsize=60&text=THE%20GENERAL%20STORE&wrap=2)** by Linotype [1993]

Good call Fivos. Here is Times Eighteen compressed to 60%

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317121704im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Times18at60pct_3545.jpg)
  
Close. Not quite enough compression for \_G\_, too much for \_R\_, etc.  
Don

You can't get much closer than this. Make small caps version of the previous result by reducing height to 80%.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317121704im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Times18at60pctSCvert80pct_4083.jpg)
  
Don

Thanks both.  
This looks great.  
Can you tell me what I should use for the compression.  
David

Compress to 60% horizontal to make the uppercase. Then use a copy of this to make the lower case [small caps] by compressing to 80%.  
don
